abstract.p: Virginia P French is promoted to vice president for advertising at New York Times (S)

block.p: Virginia P. French, who has overseen arts and entertainment advertising sales and marketing for The New York Times since 1996, has been promoted to vice president for advertising, the newspaper said yesterday.

Ms. French, 47, will be responsible for the newspaper's national sales offices, as well as arts and entertainment advertising sales, and will report to Jyll F. Holzman, senior vice president for advertising. Ms. French is the newspaper's first vice president for advertising to be based in Los Angeles.

Virginia P. French, who has overseen arts and entertainment advertising sales and marketing for The New York Times since 1996, has been promoted to vice president for advertising, the newspaper said yesterday.

Ms. French, 47, will be responsible for the newspaper's national sales offices, as well as arts and entertainment advertising sales, and will report to Jyll F. Holzman, senior vice president for advertising. Ms. French is the newspaper's first vice president for advertising to be based in Los Angeles.
Ms. French, a graduate of the University of Vermont, joined The Times in 1978 in the telephone sales department. From 1988 to 1990 she was advertising manager of The New York Times Magazine.
